summary: I keep reading "I was disappointed with the death of the NK or It makes no sense that Arya killed him"... EXCUSE ME BISH?! ARYA...
body:
I keep reading “I was disappointed with the death of the NK or It makes no sense that Arya killed him”… EXCUSE ME BISH?! ARYA SAVED HUMANITY AND NOW WE CAN FOCUS ON THE THRONE BULL!

I really cannot deal with people.

What did they want ? The NK destroying everything on the 3rd episode and the rest of the season would be bloopers or BTS ?!

reblog.comment:

summary: This music is perhaps the new Light of the Seven for me. It is so wonderfully layered and at first it feels hopeless as the...
caption:
This music is perhaps the new Light of the Seven for me. It is so wonderfully layered and at first it feels hopeless as the Night King’s forces overrun the castle and the crypts, Jon is pinned by a wounded but enraged wight-Viserion, and Theon stands alone, holding off multiple wights as more keep coming. But as the music progresses, glimmers of hope appear. The living, against all odds, are holding their own against the endless tide, despite the casualties. And as the Night King approaches Bran, feeling that his victory is now assured and basking at the moment, is taken off guard by the one thing he never saw coming, but what Bran had planned for.

A young woman, heir to a legacy stretching back generations, trained in the art of fighting, stealth, and deception, becomes the one to kill the greatest threat mankind had ever faced, and bring back the dawn.

summary: Bran Stark has been a pretty much emotionless shell of his former self since becoming the three eyed raven because of the weight...
body:
Bran Stark has been a pretty much emotionless shell of his former self since becoming the three eyed raven because of the weight of the call and yet he VISIBLY GOT EMOTIONAL WHEN HE TOLD THEON HE WAS A GOOD MAN AND KNEW HE WAS ABOUT TO DIE. THEON LOOKED AT HIM WITH TEARS IN HIS EYES KNOWING HE CAN FINALLY BE AT PEACE WITH HIMSELF AND HIS PAST SINS. 

and y’all have the audacity to say this episode lacked the weight of human emotions.

tags: he’s literally paralysed wtf do you want him to do
summary: Bran, a disabled boy (not even a man yet), with nothing to physically protect himself should things go wrong, agreed on being...
body:
Bran, a disabled boy (not even a man yet), with nothing to physically protect himself should things go wrong, agreed on being bait to the Night King so that they’d have a better chance of killing him and thus, his army of the dead

But sure, he didn’t do anything

title: Game of Thrones Season 8| How Arya Stark Got The Dagger?
body:
How #AryaStark Got The Dagger? #GameOfThrones #ForTheThrone #GoTS8 #SpoilerAlert Bran Stark received the dagger from little finger, who got it from Bran’s mother before she died. Bran handed the dagger to Arya Stark based on his visions for future for the battle with dead & #NightKing #CatchItFirst

summary: God how the Starklings care so much for each other just Really Jumped Out this episode  Arya - her jumping into danger of...
body:
God how the Starklings care so much for each other just Really Jumped Out this episode 

Arya - her jumping into danger of course, fighting through white walkers and having a mini-breakdown before realizing that she could save everyone and save Bran, but also her making sure that Sansa is in the crypts the second things get explicitly dangerous. She gives Sansa a dagger to defend herself, or to make her feel safe, and she makes sure Sansa is out of danger to the best of her ability. 

Sansa and Bran, even, though we obviously see it less so than Arya and Jon. There’s something to be said about how with how muted Bran is and how much he talks about how he’s no longer Bran, he still calls Winterfell “home” to Theon. He’s calm when the NK is there because he knows his siblings are going to protect him, that Arya is going to keep him safe. Whether that’s because there’s still Bran in there or because he gave her the dagger knowing everything that was going to argue, or maybe a bit of both, you can argue about, but I personally like to think that there’s a piece of Bran in there that knew his siblings weren’t going to let him die. 

And Sansa - she doesn’t want to go, but she realizes that if she stays, she’s going to be a liability. The best way to protect her siblings is to go down into the crypts and make sure they’re not worried about protecting her, because they already need to look after Bran as well. It’s like she says - she has to look the truth in the face, and while she wants to protect her family and her home, the best way to do that is to know when she is needed and not put everyone else at risk. 

Jon, Jon!!!! Jon running through Winterfell, seeing his best friend being attacked by white walkers, a friend who he would easily die for and has fought to protect before, and just moving forward because any time spent with them is going to be more time away from Bran, a second that might prevent him from saving Bran. This man is ready to face an undead dragon and just scream and go at it because it’s wasting time from him getting to Bran and he was ready to start swinging. He was willing to go to the Night King, to a dragon, all for Bran, because it’s not just the whole issue about the dead winning, it’s also about keeping his little brother safe and god knows he’s not going to lose another brother, not again, not like this (and third time’s the charm, right? Jon may not have gotten to Bran but this time he ran towards a brother and the brother ended up safe). And god, Jon telling Dany just, just, “Bran,” and despite everything they’ve gone through and are currently going through she nods because she knows, she knows what it means that the dead have breached not just for the world but to Jon, because the thought of losing any of his siblings is going to be the end of the world for these Starklings.

Anyway it was just!!! I want more explicit Starklings because these were small and subtle but it just got me because they love each other so much and can’t bear to lose each other someone protect them!!!

Whether that’s because there’s still Bran in there or because he gave her the dagger knowing everything that was going to argue, or maybe a bit of both, you can argue about, but I personally like to think that there’s a piece of Bran in there that knew his siblings weren’t going to let him die. 

And Sansa - she doesn’t want to go, but she realizes that if she stays, she’s going to be a liability. The best way to protect her siblings is to go down into the crypts and make sure they’re not worried about protecting her, because they already need to look after Bran as well. It’s like she says - she has to look the truth in the face, and while she wants to protect her family and her home, the best way to do that is to know when she is needed and not put everyone else at risk. 

Jon, Jon!!!! Jon running through Winterfell, seeing his best friend being attacked by white walkers, a friend who he would easily die for and has fought to protect before, and just moving forward because any time spent with them is going to be more time away from Bran, a second that might prevent him from saving Bran. This man is ready to face an undead dragon and just scream and go at it because it’s wasting time from him getting to Bran and he was ready to start swinging. He was willing to go to the Night King, to a dragon, all for Bran, because it’s not just the whole issue about the dead winning, it’s also about keeping his little brother safe and god knows he’s not going to lose another brother, not again, not like this (and third time’s the charm, right? And god, Jon telling Dany just, just, “Bran,” and despite everything they’ve gone through and are currently going through she nods because she knows, she knows what it means that the dead have breached not just for the world but to Jon, because the thought of losing any of his siblings is going to be the end of the world for these Starklings.

Anyway it was just!!! I want more explicit Starklings because these were small and subtle but it just got me because they love each other so much and can’t bear to lose each other someone protect them!!!

summary: *whispers* i'm... so disappointed. and this is coming for someone who couldn't give less of a shit about the war against the...
body: *whispers* i’m… so disappointed. and this is coming for someone who couldn’t give less of a shit about the war against the others and dragons and magic in general in the got world, but come on… arya did the deed? the most important deed of the series? why the lord of light bothered to bring jon snow’s ass back from the dead if not to serve a purpose? if it’s anything other than being an integral piece in this conflict it’s already fucking ridiculous. what the fuck was that, honestly… and i don’t even care about jon snow all that much but this was his fight. he fought hard to get people ready for this, he deserved the fucking spotlight. also, couldn’t these fucking showrunners try to put their small minds to think just once and make bran a piece of this story? this is his sphere, he should have helped with his skinchanging powers, there were literally so many opportunities to make him control animals or… i don’t know, a fucking dragon?? show us what the fuck he was doing besides flying above the battle as a crow to… do what? i knew this show was currently ridiculous but i should never underestimate its capacity to get worse every chance it gets.

summary: I'm totally fine with Jon not being the one to kill the night king. I'm even fine with arya being the one to give the final...
question: I'm totally fine with Jon not being the one to kill the night king. I'm even fine with arya being the one to give the final blow. I just wish it was more of a team effort between Arya and Bran. I always thought that the first scene in ep 1 with bran missing every shot and arya hitting the bullseye was foreshadowing something important. Especially since he had a few visions holding a bow and arrow, I always thought that it would come full circle but instead he just sat there.
answer: Oh yeah same they definitely dropped the ball with Bran lol no doubt about that. I’m really disappointed with his character because honestly I expected him to be the one to stop the Night King in the end and they really just didn’t do anything with his character. My original theory for the Night Kings ending was that Jamie and Bran would tag team the NK. The episode definitely had its issues and plot holes, but I went into this season with very low expectations for everyone especially Arya and to see that episode was amazing. I just have to separate the books and the show because I think the books are going to focus more on fufilling the prophecies and giving Bran a bigger arc. The show obviously needed to wrap up the NK and Brans story quick so they went with this and if I don’t think too hard about I’m happy with the episode overall.
